description: Simplify your fall clean-up with this 2-in-1 smart robot. It's 50% off on Amazon.
title: Amazon has a 50% off deal on a Roomba robot vac and mop combo

description: Starting a fall project? Grab these must-have Dewalt tools on sale now.
title: Save big on Dewalt tools at Amazon

description: A quirk of the calendar means millions of Social Security recipients won't receive checks this month.
title: Some Social Security recipients won't get September checks. Here's why.

description: Archaeologists unearthed a collection of 27 silver coins that officials say date back to the ancient Roman Republic.
title: 27 ancient silver coins found "hidden in a hole in the wall" in Sicily

description: Scammers are increasingly targeting U.S. consumers using Bitcoin teller machines, with some people losing thousands of dollars.
title: Bitcoin ATM fraud is soaring, FTC warns. Here's how the scams work.

description: The FBI says it has arrested Linda Sun, a former deputy chief of staff for New York Governor Kathy Hochul, along with her husband Chris Hu. The couple will be charged for violating the Foreign Agents Registration Act. CBS News New York's Marcia Kramer reports.
title: FBI arrests former aide to New York Governor Kathy Hochul

description: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration outlook through November indicates warmer than average temperatures are expected in 2024. CBS News national environmental correspondent David Schechter reports.
title: Warm September expected, NOAA predicts

description: Don't miss this deal on Apple AirPods. Plus, we found savings on Apple products like iPads, Apple Watches and more.
title: The best Apple AirPods deals, starting at $89

description: The Fish Creek Fire has burned more than 15,000 acres in Wyoming and has been burning since Aug. 16. Chris Joyner, a spokesperson with the Northern Rockies Incident Management Team, joins CBS News with more details.
title: Fish Creek Fire in Wyoming spreads

description: A New York man will be sentenced for making thousands of harassing calls to several U.S. lawmakers. Ade Lilly faces up to five years in prison. CBS News Justice Department reporter Rob Legare has more.
title: Sentencing for man who targeted Congress lawmakers

description: Thousands of hotel workers are on strike over decisions at some Hilton, Marriott and Hyatt properties spread across the U.S. Steven Hufana, a hotel worker from Hawaii on strike, joins CBS News with more details on the workers' demands.
title: Why hotel workers are on strike in the U.S.

description: Finishing your home improvement projects will be easier than ever with these amazing tool deals.
title: Best tool deals at Amazon

description: Monthly job growth has replaced inflation updates as the most important signal of how the economy is faring.
title: Sharp drop puts stocks on track for their worst day in nearly a month

description: Homes in Ranchos Palos Verdes, California, are without power as subterranean landslides threaten fires and house collapses. CBS News' Jonathan Vigliotti reports.
title: Power cut off for dozens in California as landslides fears, fire threats increase

description: We found the hottest tablet deal of back-to-school season: Get an entry-level Apple iPad for $199 at Amazon now.
title: We just found Apple iPad tablets on sale for $199

description: Here's how to qualify for the buy-one, get-one-free airline ticket deal that Southwest is offering for a limited time.
title: Southwest brings back Companion Pass buy-one, get-one-free promotion

description: It could take a long time to pay off $50,000 in credit card debt, but there are ways to expedite the process.
title: How long will it take to pay off $50,000 in credit card debt?

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says he will not give in to international pressure over the hostages killed in Gaza and the looming cease-fire and hostage release deal that has not been agreed to. CBS News' Imtiaz Tyab has the latest on the Israel-Hamas war and Scott MacFarlane has more on President Biden's reactions to questions about Netanyahu.
title: World reacts to Benjamin Netanyahu's comments on war, hostages killed as Biden weighs in

description: CD interest rates could soon drop. Here's why you should deposit $5,000 into a long-term CD before that happens.
title: Why you should put $5,000 into a long-term CD now

description: Russian missile strike kills dozens in Ukrainian city of Poltava; Harris campaign launches bus tour in Florida focused on reproductive rights.
title: 9/3: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: Discover what's new in the latest Google Pixel 9 Pro smartphones from our hands-on review of these Android devices.
title: Google Pixel 9 Pro review: So smart it's almost spooky

description: Protests sparked around Columbia University in New York City as students return to campus for a new semester. Protesters want the university to drop its ties with Israel over the war in Gaza. CBS News' Lilia Luciano reports.
title: Columbia University protests over support for Israel

description: As the 2024 presidential election campaign season enters its last phase, Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are making sure to vie for the support of several key battleground states. CBS News campaign reporters Aaron Navarro and Jake Rosen have more.
title: Kamala Harris, Donald Trump target 2024 battleground states

description: Here's where the mosquito-borne diseases West Nile virus​ and eastern equine encephalitis​ are being reported in the U.S. in 2024.
title: Maps show states with West Nile virus and EEE cases

description: The Indian state of West Bengal passed a law seeking the death penalty for rapists in the wake of a doctor's brutal rape and murder.
title: Indian state passes law seeking death penalty for rapists

description: A $700,000 mortgage comes with reasonable monthly payments now. But they could drop further in the months to come.
title: How much would a $700,000 mortgage cost per month?

description: Officials haven't said how the boy, who is in custody, was related to the victims.
title: 10-year-old boy shoots, kills ex-Louisiana town mayor and his daughter

description: Reflecting on her historic 2024 Olympic Games in Paris, Katie Ledecky said she would love to compete at the 2028 Los Angeles Games.
title: Olympian Katie Ledecky aims for LA Games as she reflects on Paris Olympics

description: Stalled cease-fire negotiations spark mass protests and strike in Israel; Boat carrying migrants capsizes in English Channel.
title: 9/3: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: If you want to have your credit card debt forgiven, here's how long you can expect the process to take.
title: How long does it take to settle your credit card debt?

description: The couple — who prosecutors say had a "long-unfulfilled wish to have a daughter" — are also accused of killing the Ukrainian woman's mother.
title: Couple accused of killing Ukrainian refugee to kidnap her newborn

description: Pope Francis arrived in Indonesia Tuesday morning on an 11-day trip across southeast Asia, his longest trip since becoming the Catholic Church's top leader. CBS News' Anna Matranga is traveling with the pope and has more on his visit.
title: Pope Francis arrives in Indonesia for historic trip

description: Long-term tensions between the U.S. and Venezuela have escalated after U.S. authorities seized a luxury jet used by Venezuela's leader, Nicolás Maduro. CBS News intelligence and national security reporter Olivia Gazis has more.
title: What to know after U.S. seizes Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro's plane

description: As kids work to shake the summer slump, many are turning to energy drinks to give them that extra boost to get through the day. And that spike in caffeine intake is leading to concerns about rapid heart rates, anxiety attacks and even seizures. CBS News medical contributor Dr. Celine Gounder has more on some of the risks that come with energy drinks.
title: New health concerns about teens and energy drinks

description: A new ABC News/Ipsos poll shows Vice President Kamala Harris is getting a 13% boost from women voters against former President Donald Trump. CBS News campaign reporter Nidia Cavazos has more.
title: Kamala Harris getting 13% boost from women voters in ABC News/Ipsos poll

description: Linda Sun, a former aide to New York Gov. Kathy Hochul, was arrested by the FBI Tuesday morning, the FBI confirmed.
title: Former aide to N.Y. Gov. Kathy Hochul arrested, FBI says

description: Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu says he will not "give in to pressure" to agree to a truce in the war with Hamas.
title: Defiant Netanyahu dismisses rising demands for cease-fire in war with Hamas

description: Gold prices have hit record highs — but is there more room to grow? There could be, according to the experts.
title: How high will the price of gold climb this fall? Here's what experts say

description: Two U.S. Marines sent to Turkey to help protect Israel came under attack by a mob Monday in the city of Izmir. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams has more.
title: 2 U.S. Marines attacked during port visit in Turkey

description: Former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo is set to testify publicly before a Republican-led House subcommittee next week.
title: Andrew Cuomo to testify before Congressional panel on COVID response

description: As thousands of protesting Israelis demand that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu do more to reach a cease-fire and hostage-release deal with Hamas, Netanyahu is saying he will not give into pressure. President Biden has also said it's clear Netanyahu isn't doing enough to end the war. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab and CBS News national security contributor Samantha Vinograd have more on the war.
title: Netanyahu pushes back against pressure from Biden, Israeli citizens to end war in Gaza

description: Kyndle Wylde, the winner of "CBS Mornings" Mixtape Music Competition, grew up singing in her family's worship band before moving to Nashville.
title: "CBS Mornings" Mixtape Music Competition winner announced

description: Actor Max Greenfield, star of hit series "The Neighborhood" and "New Girl," discusses his new children's book, "Good Nice Thoughts." The book, inspired by his friendship with the late actor Leslie Jordan, aims to help kids tackle their anxieties.
title: Actor Max Greenfield hopes new book helps kids face anxieties

description: "Unfortunately, the bottom of the boat ripped open," said Olivier Barbarin, mayor of a town in northern France where a first aid post was set up to treat victims.
title: At least 12 dead as boat with dozens of migrants rips apart off French coast

description: A bus crashed into a group of students and their parents outside a middle school in eastern China's Tai'an city on Tuesday morning, the second day back to school after summer vacation. Six parents and five students were killed, police said. Footage from the aftermath of the incident shows a fallen tree and an overturned scooter as people rush to help one of the injured victims.
title: Bus crashes into students and parents outside China school, killing 11

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, Elizabeth Werner shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson defended her dissenting opinion in an Idaho abortion case.
title: Justice Jackson defends Idaho abortion dissent

description: Kyndle Wylde talks about her reaction to winning "CBS Mornings" Mixtape Music Competition and what's next for her in her music career.
title: Kyndle Wylde reacts to winning "CBS Mornings" Mixtape Music Competition

description: Hundreds of thousands of people protested again on Monday in Israel, accusing their government of stalling on a cease-fire deal to bring hostages home after six were recently killed in Gaza. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has reiterated his focus on retaliation against Hamas.
title: Israelis protest, demand cease-fire after 6 hostages killed in Gaza

description: Some experts expect mortgage rates to drop a little this fall, but how much will that rate drop be?
title: What's the mortgage interest rate forecast for September 2024?

description: DirecTV customers can qualify for a $20 credit after the Walt Disney Co. pulled ESPN, Disney and other networks from the service.
title: How DirecTV subscribers can get a $20 credit for the Disney blackout

description: You voted, and the winner of the "CBS Mornings" Mixtape Music Competition is Kyndle Wylde. The singer-songwriter grew up singing in her family's worship band at church and moved to Nashville to pursue her dreams of a career in music.
title: "CBS Mornings" Mixtape Music Competition winner revealed

description: At the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, swimmer Katie Ledecky became the most decorated female American Olympian of all time. Her new memoir, "Just Add Water," follows her journey from Bethesda, Maryland, to becoming one of the greatest athletes of her generation. Ledecky speaks to "CBS Mornings" about the Paris Games and what's ahead for the 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angeles.
title: Olympic champion Katie Ledecky reflects on Paris Games, plans for 2028 Olympics

description: DirecTV lost all of its Disney-owned channels over the weekend, including ABC and ESPN, after the two companies failed to reach a new distribution deal. The two sides are unable to agree on fees that DirecTV pays Disney for its programming. The impasse affects over 11 million customers.
title: DirecTV customers lose access to Disney, ESPN channels amid contract dispute

description: On Sunday, former President Donald Trump spoke to Fox News about his "right to interfere" with the 2020 election. CBS News campaign reporter Jake Rosen has more on that and the rest of the news from the Trump campaign.
title: Trump says he had a right to interfere with 2020 election

description: An archery hunter was hospitalized with injuries after being attacked by a grizzly bear in northern Idaho.
title: Grizzly bear attacks and injures archery hunter in northern Idaho

description: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss her historic confirmation to the court, support from her husband and two daughters, and her new memoir, "Lovely One."
title: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson's memoir reveals details on Supreme Court confirmation, family life

description: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, the first Black woman to serve on the U.S.' highest court, talks with "CBS Mornings" about her path to the Supreme Court, term limits for the court and her dissent in a major ruling.
title: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson on journey to Supreme Court, reforms and more

description: Some people in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, may need to evacuate their homes due to a landslide crisis. Power was shut off to more than 200 homes in the community near Los Angeles over the weekend. Officials are worried that shifting land could damage electrical equipment and cause fires.
title: Landslide crisis threatens hundreds of homes in Rancho Palos Verdes, California

description: The U.S. seized a plane used by Venezuela's leader, Nicolás Maduro, and flew it to Fort Lauderdale, Florida. The jet was allegedly illegally purchased and taken out of the U.S. in violation of sanctions. The seizure comes as Venezuela is still reeling from disputed elections earlier this year.
title: U.S. seizes Venezuelan president's plane over alleged sanction violations

description: The quarterfinals for the U.S. Open tennis tournament are beginning Tuesday in New York City as we get closer to crowning the next men's and women's grand slam champions. Matthew Futterman, senior tennis writer for the Athletic, joined CBS News to talk about the tournament.
title: U.S. Open tennis quarterfinals getting underway

description: Two U.S. Marines serving on the USS Wasp were attacked during a port visit in Izmir, Turkey, the U.S. Navy says. Video of the incident shows a group of men forcing a bag over the head of one of the Marines as they restrain him. The U.S. military says the Marines were not injured and are back onboard their ship. Turkish authorities say they detained 15 people in connection with the attack.
title: U.S. Marines attacked during port visit in Turkey

description: 35-year-old Ade Lilly is set to be sentenced Tuesday after he pleaded guilty to making more than 12,000 harassing and threatening calls to more than 50 congressional offices in recent years. CBS News Homeland Security & Justice reporter Nicole Sganga has more.
title: Sentencing for man who made 12,000 harassing phone calls to members of Congress

description: Former President Donald Trump has a new book out Tuesday called "Save America," that bills itself as a roadmap for the future if Trump is reelected. CBS News campaign reporter Jake Rosen has more.
title: Trump releases new book, "Save America"

description: The strike appeared to be one of the deadliest carried out by Russian forces since the war began more than 900 days ago
title: Russian missile strike kills 41 people and wounds 180 in Ukrainian city of Poltava, Zelenskyy says

description: Vice President Kamala Harris joined President Biden in Pittsburgh Monday for their first official joint campaign appearance since Biden stepped aside and Harris took over as the Democratic presidential nominee. During the rally, Harris spoke about her commitment to keeping American steel jobs in the U.S. CBS News campaign reporter Nidia Cavazos has more on how Biden is trying to help Harris' White House prospects.
title: Inside Biden's role on Kamala Harris' campaign

description: Tens of thousands of Israelis took to the streets for a second night to demand Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu bring an end to the war in Gaza and reach a deal to free hostages. Also, Kamala Harris campaigns with President Biden for the first time in Pennsylvania. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Mass demonstrations erupt in Israel over government's handling of war

description: Rebecca Cheptegei's boyfriend, Dickson Ndiema, poured petrol on her and set her ablaze during an argument, police said.
title: Olympic athlete set on fire by her boyfriend, police say

description: Human remains discovered by children in 1993 south of Indianapolis have been identified as a man from South Carolina, authorities said.
title: Suspected homicide victim ID'd 31 years after remains found by kids

description: Researchers discovered the first known case of a porbeagle shark likely being killed by a large shark predator, raising questions about whether this rare instance represents a larger trend.
title: Researchers find evidence that large sharks may be hunting each other

description: Asian American and Pacific Islander women once had a relatively low rate of breast cancer diagnoses. Now, researchers are scrambling to understand what's changed.
title: Breast cancer rising among Asian American and Pacific Islander women

description: Officials in the Democratic Republic of the Congo say at least 129 people were killed, mostly in a stampede, during an attempted prison escape in Kinshasa.
title: Almost 130 killed in attempted prison escape in Congo, authorities say

description: Police in China have taken a bus driver into custody after the vehicle crashed into students and parents outside a school in Shandong province, killing 11 people.
title: 11 killed as bus crashes into students, parents outside school in China

description: Israeli-American hostage killed in Gaza laid to rest; Drummer and collector opens school to inspire young musicians
title: 9/2: CBS Evening News

description: The teen idol who helped ignite the 1960s surfing craze as a handsome beach boy in the "Gidget" movies, James Darren has died at 88.
title: James Darren, "Gidget" actor, singer and director, dies at 88
